DOCNAME: CASE OF DORIĆ v. BOSNIA AND HERZEGOVINA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Civil proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant instituted civil proceedings against his employer , the local police , seeking his reinstatement and damages . His claim was eventually rejected .
CARDINAL . The first - instance judgment was rendered by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The second - instance judgment was rendered by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . The third - instance judgment was rendered by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a constitutional appeal with ORG complaining under LAW No . CARDINAL about the outcome and length of his labour dispute .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found a breach of the applicant ’s right to a trial within a reasonable time and rejected the remainder of the case . It did not award any damages .
